problem.description: Can hunter guarantee distance ≤ 100 after 10^9 rounds?

adversarial_100.description: Rabbit always moves away, tracking maximally misleading

spiral_100.description: Rabbit moves in spiral, tracking perpendicular

adversarial_1000.description: Longer run to observe growth pattern

theoretical_analysis.analysis: Theoretical analysis suggests O(sqrt(n)) bound is achievable

insights.observation_1: With adversarial rabbit and worst-case tracking, distance grows approximately linearly at small scales
insights.observation_2: With random movement, distance remains bounded due to randomness
insights.observation_3: Greedy strategy (move toward reported point) is not sufficient
insights.observation_4: sqrt(10^9) ≈ 31623, which is greater than target 100
insights.observation_5: A smarter strategy is needed: hunter should move toward expected rabbit position, not just reported point
insights.key_insight: The answer is likely YES - hunter can guarantee distance ≤ 100 using an averaging/centroid strategy
